column5: Considering buying a fillet knife on-line from the states. Is this possible? Is it a PITA?
It was no problem for me.  I've ordered fillet knives twice from the US with no hassle..
Which one & from where? (I'm a knife nut too.) You can haggle with these guys.. http://www.srknives.com/
Ive bought a couple knives from the states on ebay without any problems at all.
My next door neighbour buys knives all the time from the U.S. He has never had a problem and has bought about 25 so far.
What fillet knife can you buy there.you cant buy here??????? Just curious ?
You wont have a problem. I have done it a few times with no problem
Just looking at some custom knives.

If you are interested in "custom knives" have a look at this link  http://www.postknives.com/  I have owned two of his filet knives for about 10 years now, these are fantastic well balance knives.  Support Canadian craftsmen  just JOHN
I bought 5 benchmade knives from the US a little while back with no problem. As long as the knife is leagal in Canada, no switch blades.  Daniel OCH
I dont have any custom fillet knives.  But i got some of these.

I have a large knife collection, new and old. I buy from the States all the time. I just ordered custom fillet knives and a skinning knife from these folks. They make the knives any way you want, custom to your fit. I have several other contacts if you wish.  http://www.sunrisecustomknives.com/
